channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12773] Add warning message when user is trying to bulkload a large HFile.
item.summary: Add warning message when user is trying to bulkload a large HFile.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: shouldn't the warn be on the client side or both client/rs? once you look at the RS log it is probably already too late.
You're right. Will add the warning on client side too.

This message is automatically generated.

ok, what about avoiding the extra NN call to get the file len and do something like?


--- a/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/LoadIncrementalHFiles.java

+++ b/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/LoadIncrementalHFiles.java

@@ -206,8 +206,11 @@ public class LoadIncrementalHFiles extends Configured implements Tool {

       }

       Path familyDir = stat.getPath();

       byte[] family = familyDir.getName().getBytes();

-      Path[] hfiles = FileUtil.stat2Paths(fs.listStatus(familyDir));

-      for (Path hfile : hfiles) {

+      FileStatus[] hfiles = fs.listStatus(familyDir);

+      for (FileStatus hfileStatus : hfiles) {

+        // Skip "_", reference, HFileLink

+        Path hfile = hfileStatus.getPath();

+        long length = hfileStatus.getLen();

         // Skip "_", reference, HFileLink

         String fileName = hfile.getName();

         if (fileName.startsWith("_")) continue;

we already have the FileStatus for the hfiles, but we were throwing them away with stat2Paths()
Thanks Matteo for pointing to the nice optimization. Integrated the suggestion to v4.
